verses.roman:
kṛṣṇake karāya śyāma-rasa-madhu pāna
nirantara pūrṇa kare kṛṣṇera sarva-kāma

synonyms: kṛṣṇake—unto Kṛṣṇa; karāya—She induces; śyāma-rasa—of the mellow of conjugal love; madhu—the honey; pāna—drinking; nirantara—constantly; pūrṇa—complete; kare—makes; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; sarva-kāma—all kinds of lusty desires.
translation: "Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī induces Kṛṣṇa to drink the honey of the conjugal relationship. She is therefore engaged in satisfying all the lusty desires of Kṛṣṇa.
